content.description: This route is unlike most routes at Cochiti, with few pockets, many crimps, and a few slopey jugs.  Unfortunately this overhanging wall is over almost as soon as it begins, and it hardly seems worth all the trouble to get to.
content.protection: 5 bolts, no anchor.  Approach via rappel, or with trad gear, a rope and belay from the base of Red Zinger.  The sloping 'ledge' at the base of the route has one questionable fixed bolt, and one gaping hole where the other bolt used to be.  Bring one or two 3/4"-1.5" cams to back up this bolt.
content.location: Next route East from Red Zinger, immediately around the arete.

content.description:
This beautiful route would be an ultra-classic if it were located in a more populated area.  With small, deep, incut pockets, this light pink stone is remeniscent of some of the finer walls at Enchanted Tower.  A trivial un-bolted slab leads to a no-hands stance and the first bolt.  From here shoot up and to the left on a steep wall, clipping 2 more bolts before the route leans back to vertical.  Three more bolts on easing terrain lead to the lip. 

  The Samet guide states that one should finish up the arete, but its possible and no harder to climb without using the arete.
content.protection: 6 bolts, no anchor.  If approaching ground up, bring some trad gear, or solo up 25 feet to the first bolt.  If rapping in, clip the  lead line in to the first two bolts on the way down.
content.location: The next route East from Adolescent Fantasy, immediately around the arete.

climbs.name: Red Zinger
climbs.fa: Ed Romback, Victor Salazar, Leslie Coon, Spring 1989

content.description: This route ascends an open book that leads to a nice face and arete on very good, dark brown rock.  The route is nicely featured, and if not for the lengthy, trivial dihedral start, would be 3 stars.  If you are in search of 5.10 fun, this route is a must do, with deep pockets, some nice arete moves, and a challenging bulge finish.
content.protection:
4 bolts, no anchor.  Bring gear for the first 30 feet if approaching ground up.   

  If rapping in, clip the lead line into the first 2 bolts on the way down.  You might want some gear for the belay at the cliff base.
content.location: Next bolted route E of Stridex.

content.description:
This fun line is the furthest West route, and the only one with a fixed anchor.  The climbing is slabby with beautifual dark brown rock and largish, incut pockets and a few nubbins. 

  The route faces West, so shade in early AM.
content.protection: Bolts and 2 bolt anchor.  There is no anchor at the base, but its a safe ledge to be unroped.
content.location:
Furthest west.  Rap in.  It may be possible to scramble down to the base.  From this route its possible to scramble unroped over to Stridex and Red Zinger.  Ropes and trad rack would be required to reach Wasted Youth. 

  15 feet opposite of this route and facing East is the very short route "Coming of Age" 5.6.  It appears the bolts on this route have been chopped, but I could be wrong.  I'm sure it would be easy to TR.

pathTokens: Capulin Canyon and Cochiti Mesa Area Crags

content.description:
This area is visible to the NW from Cochiti Mesa.  It offers a small number of high quality routes with the shortest approach at Cochiti.  All routes are approached by rappelling, and only one route has an anchor, so its a good idea to bring an extra rope for rigging tree anchors. 

  All of these routes lose a star because of the hassle of rapping in and rigging temporary anchors.  Adolescent Fantasy and Stridex would be 4 stars if not for the inconvenience.
